MenuNavigationText:
<SelectionColor>Menu navigation</SelectionColor>
Use menu to navigate to different sections of the application.

<SelectionColor>1) Navigating to menu items</SelectionColor>
 > Press <ReasonColor>{0}</ReasonColor> on your keyboard to go <ReasonColor>UP</ReasonColor> one item.
 > Press <ReasonColor>{1}</ReasonColor> on your keyboard to go <ReasonColor>DOWN</ReasonColor> one item.
 > The currently selected item will have <SelectionColor>{2}</SelectionColor> color.

<SelectionColor>2) Selecting menu items</SelectionColor>
 > To select menu item, press <ReasonColor>{3}</ReasonColor> on your keyboard.

<SelectionColor>3) Navigating back</SelectionColor>
 > To go up one layer, navigate to the item "<SelectionColor>{4}</SelectionColor>" or "<SelectionColor>{5}</SelectionColor>", typically at the end of the list.
 > Alternatively, press <ReasonColor>{6}</ReasonColor> on your keyboard.
TextInputsText:
<SelectionColor>Text Inputs</SelectionColor>
User inputs that give the user opportunity to enter a text.

<SelectionColor>1) Entering text</SelectionColor>
 > Start entering text by pressing keyboard keys.

<SelectionColor>2) Navigating text</SelectionColor>
 > Press <ReasonColor>{0}</ReasonColor> to go <ReasonColor>LEFT</ReasonColor> one character in your input field.
 > Press <ReasonColor>{1}</ReasonColor> to go <ReasonColor>RIGHT</ReasonColor> one character in your input field.
 > Press <ReasonColor>{2}</ReasonColor> to go <ReasonColor>UP</ReasonColor> one row in your input field, if your answer has more than one row.
 > Press <ReasonColor>{3}</ReasonColor> to go <ReasonColor>DOWN</ReasonColor> one row in your input field, if your answer has more than one row.

<SelectionColor>3) Input correction</SelectionColor>
 > Press <ReasonColor>{4}</ReasonColor> to remove one character before your cursor in the input field.
 > Press <ReasonColor>{5}</ReasonColor> to remove one character afer your cursor in the input field.

<SelectionColor>4) Input termination</SelectionColor>
 > Press <ReasonColor>{6}</ReasonColor> to <ReasonColor>CONFIRM</ReasonColor> your input.
 > Press <ReasonColor>{7}</ReasonColor> to <ReasonColor>CANCEL</ReasonColor> your input.
NumberInputsText:
<SelectionColor>Number Inptus</SelectionColor>
Whole number inputs.

<SelectionColor>1) Entering a number</SelectionColor>
 > Start entering a number by pressing number keys on your keyboard.

<SelectionColor>2) Navigating text</SelectionColor>
 > Press <ReasonColor>{0}</ReasonColor> to go <ReasonColor>LEFT</ReasonColor> one character in your input field.
 > Press <ReasonColor>{1}</ReasonColor> to go <ReasonColor>RIGHT</ReasonColor> one character in your input field.
 > Press <ReasonColor>{2}</ReasonColor> to go <ReasonColor>UP</ReasonColor> one row in your input field, if your answer has more than one row.
 > Press <ReasonColor>{3}</ReasonColor> to go <ReasonColor>DOWN</ReasonColor> one row in your input field, if your answer has more than one row.

<SelectionColor>3) Input correction</SelectionColor>
 > Press <ReasonColor>{4}</ReasonColor> to remove one character before your cursor in the input field.
 > Press <ReasonColor>{5}</ReasonColor> to remove one character afer your cursor in the input field.

<SelectionColor>4) Input termination</SelectionColor>
 > Press <ReasonColor>{6}</ReasonColor> to <ReasonColor>CONFIRM</ReasonColor> your input.
 > Press <ReasonColor>{7}</ReasonColor> to <ReasonColor>CANCEL</ReasonColor> your input.
SelectionInputsText:
<SelectionColor>Selection inputs</SelectionColor>
Inputs that let the user decide between multiple options.

<SelectionColor>1) Navigating to different items</SelectionColor>
 > Press <ReasonColor>{0}</ReasonColor> on your keyboard to go <ReasonColor>UP</ReasonColor> one item.
 > Press <ReasonColor>{1}</ReasonColor> on your keyboard to go <ReasonColor>DOWN</ReasonColor> one item.
 > If the list has more than one page, press <ReasonColor>{2}</ReasonColor> on your keyboard to go to the <ReasonColor>NEXT PAGE</ReasonColor>. Alternatively you can navigate to the "<SelectionColor>{3}</SelectionColor>" item.
 > If the list has more than one page, press <ReasonColor>{4}</ReasonColor> on your keyboad to go to the <ReasonColor>PREVIOUS PAGE</ReasonColor>. Alternatively you can navigate to the "<SelectionColor>{5}</SelectionColor>" item.
 > The currently selected item will have <SelectionColor>{6}</SelectionColor> color.

<SelectionColor>2) Input termination</SelectionColor>
 > Press <ReasonColor>{7}</ReasonColor> to <ReasonColor>CONFIRM</ReasonColor> your input.
 > Press <ReasonColor>{8}</ReasonColor> to <ReasonColor>CANCEL</ReasonColor> your input.
ChooseOpponentType: Do you want your opponent to be a player or computer?
TextTooShort: Must be at least {0} characters long
TextTooLong: Must not be longer than {0} characters
TooSmallNumber: Must be bigger than or equal to {0}
TooBigNumber: Must be smaller than or equal to {0}
